data.name: Rolling Substitution Cipher
data.description:
In this kata you are tasked with enciphering and deciphering messages with a rolling substitution cipher. To encrypt a message using a given key you write out the message, say, "the quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dogs". Then you write your key, say "codewars" in a loop beneath it:

```
the quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dogs
codewarscodewarscodewarscodewarscodewarscode
```
   
Then you apply a Ceaser cipher using the letter in the message and the letter beneath it (spaces are just mapped to spaces in this kata):

```
t == 20, c == 3 so t => 20 + 3 = 23 == w,
h == 8, o == 15 so h => 8 + 15 = 23 == w,
...
```

In this way, the message is encrypted to give:

```
the quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dogs
wwi nvavn fwlxf idb gveiv sabs mkt qxaq gdkx
   ```
   
To decrypt this message, the same approach is taken, however instead of adding the value of the key character, you subtract it (modulo 26):

```
wwi nvavn fwlxf idb gveiv sabs mkt qxaq gdkx
codewarscodewarscodewarscodewarscodewarscode
   ```
   
 ```
w == 23, c == 3 so w => 23 - 3 = 20 == t,
w == 23, o == 15 so w => 23 - 15 = 8 == h,
   ...
   ```
   
```
wwi nvavn fwlxf idb gveiv sabs mkt qxaq gdkx
the quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dogs
```

In this kata you must make two methods: ```encrypt``` and ```decrypt``` both taking strings ```message``` and ```key```. The message and key will always be lower case and will not contain any punctuation (messages will contain spaces). 

Good luck and jdsi mmvn!
